Bertil Chapuis

I’m a passionate software engineer who loves hacking and collaborating at the intersection of several disciplines. My area of expertise overlaps with location-aware computing, distributed systems, databases, data structures, network protocols and information security.

I recently completed a PhD in Information Systems at the University of Lausanne, where my research lied at the intersection of geographical information systems, distributed systems, and information security. In parallel to that, I co-founded Astrocast, a fast growing startup active in the Internet of Things. Prior to that, I worked for several years in startups and as a freelance, successfully completing numberous projects in public transportion and watch making companies.

Early in my career, I have been exposed to extreme programming (XP) and open source development, which taught me the importance of test automation, build reproducibility and continuous integration. I believe these practices greatly contribute at establishing a productive development environment. I often experienced first hand the ups and downs of being (too?) curious, but I’m not getting tired of learning yet!
